title: Add dropTable purge option to Catalog API
body:
This fixes [concerns](https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/pull/240#discussion_r298692031) [raised](https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/pull/240#discussion_r298690327) on the commit that added `HiveCatalog`. Specifically:

* The call to Hive's drop table should specify not to delete data, in case older tables are not external
* There should be a way to clean up table data as part of the drop operation

For the second change, this adds `Catalog.dropTable(table, purge)` that can leave data or delete all files referenced in the metadata tree. `Catalog.dropTable(table)` now calls `Catalog.dropTable(table, purge=true)`.

title: Remove unreferenced hash computations
body:
The types float, double, and boolean are excluded from bucket
partitioning, which is the only part of the spec that uses hashing. As
such, we can remove these types from "Appendix B: 32-bit Hash
Requirements".

title: Avoid floating point number ordering NaN semantics
body:
This patch prohibits the use of NaNs in ordering semantics for
floating point numbers, including in sort_columns, lower_bounds,
lower_bound, upper_bounds, and upper_bound. It additionally requires
that those fields respect the IEEE 754 totalOrder predicate, which
defines negative zero as being ordered before positive zero.

That requirement will be invisible on the read path for processes
that use the numeric less-than, rather than totalOrder, since the
numeric comparators consider negative zero as ordered neither before
nor after positive zero.

milestone.title: Format Version 2
milestone.description: Changes needed to finalize table format version 2.

title: Refactor BaseMetastoreCatalog and remove dependency on Hadoop Config
body: IMHO, Class `BaseMetastoreCatalog` should not contain assumptions that we are dealing with a Hadoop/ Hive metastore, and hence it should not contain references to a Hadoop `Configuration` class

title: Vectorized read
Spark: Add support for write-audit-publish workflows.
body:
This adds support for write-audit-publish (WAP) workflows. When a WAP write is committed, the new table snapshot is added to table metadata but not made the current table snapshot. Instead, an external audit process runs to validate the new data and publishes the new snapshot (updates the table's current snapshot) only when audits pass.

This adds a table property, `write.wap.enabled`, that must be true for a commit to be staged. Similarly, a Spark configuration property, `spark.wap.id`, must be set in a job for that job's changes to be staged. The job's WAP ID is added to the commit summary so that audit processes can find the changes to audit.

title: Improve filtering in Snapshot#addedFiles.
body:
This updates `addedFiles` and `deletedFiles` to scan only the manifests that were created by a snapshot to improve performance.

Fixes #337.

title: Use UnicodeUtil.truncateString for Truncate transform
body:
This truncates by unicode codepoint instead of Java chars.

Fixes #293.

title: make spark reader public to allow extension for prototyping future incremental reading in spark
Add mapping to Iceberg for external name-based schemas
body:
This adds a mapping from external schema names to Iceberg type IDs. This will be used to add Iceberg IDs to data files written without those IDs, like Avro files.

This mapping is a multi-level mapping that matches the structure of Iceberg schemas. Each nested type (struct, list, and map) has a nested mapping for its nested fields. Each field, including list element, map key, and map value, is represented using `MappedField` that contains a set of names and an optional Iceberg ID.

Mappings are updated as an Iceberg schema evolves. Renaming a field will add a new name to its mapping, and adding new fields will add new field mappings.

`NamedMapping` provides high-level methods to find mapped fields by ID or by qualified name.

Fix truncateStringMax in UnicodeUtil.
body:
Index to codePointAt should be the offset calculated by code points.
I incorrectly assumed that the index in codePointAt(index) refers to the index in terms of code points. It actually refers to the index of characters in the string. 
resolves #328 #329

title: Fix pig partition/vavlue mapping
body:
Pig was using schema ordering of partition columns to map the partition values, which produces incorrect data if the order of columns in the partition spec are not consistent with the table schema.

This patch updates the partition values mapping from DataFile to use the partition spec ordering.

Optimistically query and replace files atomically
body:
Fixes #316 

Hi, I'm trying to learn about iceberg.

One option to perform the copy-on-write/eager updates is to provide the queryTime snapshot to the ReplaceFiles SnapshotProducer. Then if the snapshot is not the queryTime snapshot, fail the commit.

I'm hoping this doesn't get retried because it is an IllegalStateException and not a CommitFailedException.

excerpt from base SnapshotProducer
```
      Tasks.foreach(ops)
          .retry(base.propertyAsInt(COMMIT_NUM_RETRIES, COMMIT_NUM_RETRIES_DEFAULT))
          .exponentialBackoff(
              base.propertyAsInt(COMMIT_MIN_RETRY_WAIT_MS, COMMIT_MIN_RETRY_WAIT_MS_DEFAULT),
              base.propertyAsInt(COMMIT_MAX_RETRY_WAIT_MS, COMMIT_MAX_RETRY_WAIT_MS_DEFAULT),
              base.propertyAsInt(COMMIT_TOTAL_RETRY_TIME_MS, COMMIT_TOTAL_RETRY_TIME_MS_DEFAULT),
              2.0 /* exponential */)
          .onlyRetryOn(CommitFailedException.class)
          .run(taskOps -> {
```

The Gradle install target produces invalid POM files that are missing
the dependencyManagement section and versions for some dependencies.
Instead, we directly tell JitPack to run the correct Gradle target.

This reverts the change in #310.

title: Synchronize write mode among writers
body:
Currently Iceberg had three writers but they have different write modes:

Writer|Mode
-|-
Parquet|Overwrite
Avro|Create   
Orc|Create   

This PR synchronizes write modes in writers and defaults them to `create` as discussed in PR #302.

title: Incremental processing implementation
body:
WIP branch to feedback on the overall approach.

The basic idea is if the user is asking for incremental scan between s1 and s2 . We only scan manifests which belong in the range (s1, s2] - [excluding s1 and including s2] and in those manifests only look at manifest entries which belong in the range (s1, s2]

title: Fix typo in error message for day transform
Add build info to README.
Use doubleToLongBits instead of doubleToRawLongBits.
Support write mode for Parquet and Avro using table property
body:
Currently in Parquet and Avro writers write mode is hard-coded. For Parquet - overwrite, Avro - create.
This PR allows to set write mode using table properties for each of the above mentioned writers thus write mode can be controlled based on the needs of Iceberg table user.

title: Avoid write failures if metrics mode is invalid
body: This updates the `MetricsConfig` class to catch exceptions thrown by `MetricsMode.fromString`. The intent is to avoid failing write jobs when a metrics mode is invalid, because users may make changes to a table while a pipeline that writes to it is deployed and running. A live pipeline should not fail because of a typo in table tuning settings.

title: [Minor] Fix HMS storage descriptor
body: This PR fixes a typo in HMS storage descriptor. It doesn't matter for correctness but might confuse people exploring HMS.

title: Fix typo in TableProperties class
Add some checks for HadoopTables#create
Bump Apache Avro to 1.9.x
body:
# Updating to Apache Avro 1.9.x

Apache Avro 1.9.0 brings a lot of new features:
* Deprecate Joda-Time in favor of Java8 JSR310 and setting it as default
* Remove support for Hadoop 1.x
* Move from Jackson 1.x to 2.9
* Add ZStandard Codec
* Lots of updates on the dependencies to fix CVE's
* Remove Jackson classes from public API
* Apache Avro is built by default with Java 8
* Apache Avro is compiled and tested with Java 11 to guarantee compatibility
* Apache Avro MapReduce is compiled and tested with Hadoop 3
* Apache Avro is now leaner, multiple dependencies were removed: guava, paranamer, commons-codec, and commons-logging
* and many, many more!

# Blockers

Currently not possible due to some regression issues. Tested with Avro 1.9.1-SNAPSHOT and this worked fine. Then again we run into some issues the Jackson parts that we've removed from Avro's public API. Parquet is on 1.8.2 and Avro itself at 1.9.0.

title: Rewrite manifest filename fix
body: This change ensures that mainfest filenames are not reused by ReplaceManifests. Currently, if a commit needs to rerun the replace manifest process because of another commit, the manifest filenames are reused. This causes an issue when writing the manifest list, as the metadata for a file is cached by file name in SnapshotProducer.

title: Add multi AND helper method
Fix specForTable in case of unpartitioned table
Fix Parquet page size property
body: This PR fixes the propagation of `write.parquet.page-size-bytes` to `ParquetWriter`.

title: Strict projection for dates timestamps
body:
Implementing strict projection for Dates and Timestamps https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/issues/35

Handling only the boundaries instead of https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/pull/283

title: Update metadata tables for unpartitioned tables
body:
This removes the `partition` column from the `files` and `entries` metadata tables when the underlying table is not partitioned. For unpartitioned tables, this is an empty struct and cannot be projected in Spark.

In support of suppressing the `partition` column, this also updates `ManifestReader` and `FilteredManifest` to support schema-based projection. Because this is already updating the `Filterable` API, this fixes #145 and adds case sensitivity methods.

title: Removes BaseMetastoreTables and HiveTables
body: Closes #278.

title: Add projectStrict for Dates and Timestamps
body:
Implementing projectStrict for Dates and Timestamps (https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/issues/35)

Includes fix of ResidualEvaluator from https://github.com/moulimukherjee/incubator-iceberg/pull/1

Expected behaviour:
ts > 2019-07-07T23:59:59.9999 will be projected strict using ts_day >= 2019-07-08
ts > 2019-07-07T15:52:50.0000 will also be projected strict using ts_day >= 2019-07-08
ts > 2019-07-07T00:00:00:0000 will be projected strict using ts_day >= 2019-07-07

title: Add Spark application ID to snapshot summary
body: This adds a property, "spark.app.id" to the snapshot summary to automatically track the Spark application that wrote a snapshot.

title: Moving/Renaming hadoop module to filesystem
body: [WIP] Exposing a generic filesystem implementation for interacting with Iceberg tables @danielcweeks @rdblue

title: Update link url in doc
body: api-quickstart.md

title: Fix iceberg-spark-runtime transitive dependencies.
body:
This updates the iceberg-spark-runtime Jar to fix dependency leaks.

Now, compileOnly dependencies (and transitive dependencies from compileOnly) are shaded and relocated. Compile dependencies remain declared compile dependencies in the output artifact. The only compile dependencies are slf4j and guava. All other dependencies are shaded.

title: Fix README link to latest spec
Refactor AvroIterable and prevent multiple iterators
Remove iceberg-presto-runtime that is no longer used.
body: Fixes #256 and fixes #160.

title: Publish resolved versions in POMs
body:
## Before this PR #241 converted the project to use GCV, but didn't add an equivalent functionality to [nebula.maven-resolved-dependencies](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-publishing-plugin#nebulamaven-resolved-dependencies), hence some dependencies are missing a version in the POM. This in turn makes the POM technically invalid and unparseable by some maven clients like aether. ## After this PR Use a gradle feature that [exposes resolved versions](https://docs.gradle.org/5.2/release-notes.html#maven-publication-can-expose-resolved-versions) in the POMs. This ensures the POM contains the actual versions you resolved, and that no entries are missing a version.
Example POM diff

```diff --- core/build/publications/nebula/pom-default.old.xml 2019-07-08 16:54:27.000000000 +0100 +++ core/build/publications/nebula/pom-default.xml 2019-07-08 16:54:32.000000000 +0100 @@ -4,5 +4,5 @@ org.apache.iceberg iceberg-core - 08e3f2d + 08e3f2d.dirty iceberg-core @@ -17,5 +17,5 @@ org.slf4j slf4j-api - 1.7.5 + 1.7.25 compile @@ -116,4 +116,5 @@ org.slf4j slf4j-api + 1.7.25 compile @@ -127,4 +128,5 @@ com.google.guava guava + 28.0-jre compile @@ -138,5 +140,5 @@ org.apache.iceberg iceberg-api - 08e3f2d + 08e3f2d.dirty compile @@ -150,5 +152,5 @@ org.apache.iceberg iceberg-common - 08e3f2d + 08e3f2d.dirty compile @@ -162,4 +164,5 @@ org.apache.avro avro + 1.8.2 compile @@ -201,4 +204,5 @@ com.github.ben-manes.caffeine caffeine + 2.7.0 compile ``` (ignore the .dirty suffixes, that'd just since I modified the working copy)

title: Simplify BucketUUID to remove thread local
body:
The primary motivation of this change is to simplify the code. As a bonus, a simple JMH benchmark shows that the new code is twice as fast:
```
Benchmark                          Mode  Cnt         Score        Error  Units
BenchmarkBucketUuid.bucketBuffer  thrpt    5  14548998.313 ± 209390.443  ops/s
BenchmarkBucketUuid.bucketDirect  thrpt    5  30708144.423 ± 522965.940  ops/s
```

title: Force to compile with UTF8 encoding
Exclude transitive artifacts already part of orc-core fat jar
body:
We are relocating hive classes in spark-runtime artifact. These relocated classes are not part our dependency graph. [Shadow plugin has this issue]. These Hive classes are coming from hive-storage-api artifact which is a transitive dependency of orc-core. orc-core, being a fat jar, already includes hive-storage-api and protobuf-java jars, which are already shaded.  A simple fix in this case is to exclude storage-api  from orc-core as this is already part of orc-core

Fixes #260

Note: protobuf is also excluded just because it is already part of orc-core. It is not related to the issue reported in #260

title: Add table UUID
body: This adds a UUID to table metadata that is randomly generated when new table metadata is created. Existing tables without a UUID will assign a UUID on a successful snapshot commit.

title: Make metrics collection configurable via table properties
body:
This PR introduces `MetricsConfig` that allows us to control metrics collection and resolves #173.

Currently, this logic is integrated only into the Parquet write path.

title: Control metadata compression via table properties
body: This PR enables us to control metadata compression via table properties instead of Hadoop conf and resolves #255.

title: Truncate stats from Parquet files
body:
Lower and upper bound values from Parquet files are not currently truncated, which takes more space than necessary in manifests. Truncating strings and binary values will probably improve performance for large tables.

This PR adds a configurable table property "write.metadata.truncate-length" with a default value of 16. Default behavior is to truncate binary values to <= 16 bytes and strings to <= 16 unicode characters.

Resolves #113

title: Register existing tables in Iceberg HiveCatalog
body: This PR allows us to register existing tables in Iceberg `HiveCatalog` and resolves #251.

title: Add metadata tables
body:
This commit adds metadata tables:
* `history` -- the snapshot log
* `snapshots` -- known snapshots
* `manifests` -- manifest files for a snapshot
* `files` -- data files for a snapshot
* `entries` -- manifest entries for a snapshot

title: Update Spark runtime Jar contents
body:
This removes the shadow configuration and minimizes the shaded dependencies for Spark using exclusions.

Fixes #217.

title: Add support for returning hive partitions that match a filter express…
body:
…ion.

Also added some unit tests for the partition scanning code.

title: Fixes `withPartitionPath` API for transform functions that consider `toHumanString` path representations incompatible as type and value with the partition value preserved in the spec
Support dynamic partition overwrite
body: This adds support in Spark for dynamic partition overwrite using `SaveMode.Overwrite` in the DataFrameWriter API.

title: [WIP] Add new Update schema API to support adding of all new fields detected based on a companion schema
body: Framing the use-case for this PR - given that most of the time data may be arriving with a partial schema than that of an Iceberg backed dataset we need to make sure that before appending new files we add the new fields to the Iceberg schema first.

title: Fix mkdocs and add missing footnotes
Add exists method to InputFile.
Use gradle-consistent-versions to manage dependencies
body:
[gradle-consistent-versions](https://github.com/palantir/gradle-consistent-versions#compalantirconsistent-versions---) is a gradle plugin to ensure every project in your gradle setup uses the same versions of each dependency, which stops subtle hard-to-debug runtime errors from arising.

The workflow is you:

1. Define what versions you want in `versions.props`
2. Run `./gradlew --write-locks` to write the entire dependency list (including transitives) to `versions.lock`.

This `versions.lock` file gives you a bird's eye view of all version numbers in your repo. The plugin also means you can use a slightly more vanilla style of declaring dependencies. One also no longer  needs any intermediate variable names. All dependencies can be declared with the following format, no version number needed:

```
dependencies {
   implementation 'com.google.guava:guava'
}
```
You can read more about it [here](https://github.com/palantir/gradle-consistent-versions#compalantirconsistent-versions---).

Original credit goes to @iamdanfox and @CRogers.

title: Add HiveCatalog implementation
body:
This is based on Parth's PR #187 and implements the review comments.

This includes an implementation of the Catalog API for Hive. It also has some minor updates to the Catalog API and fixes some problems with Hive connections found in testing. Now all Hive tests successfully run using a single shared pool of 2 connections.

Closes #187.

title: Update iceberg-spark to use HiveTables
body: This PR enables support for `HiveTables` in `IcebergSource` and resolves #8.

title: Fix row group skipping in ParquetReader.
body: By only updating the next row group index when a row group was skipped, `ParquetReader` was skipping initial row groups, then processing row groups after that without skipping because the index was not updated.

title: Fix thread safety of date formatting in BaseTableScan
body: SimpleDateFormat is not thread safe.

title: Move BaseTransaction factory methods to Transaction
body: This allows using it outside of BaseMetastoreTables.

title: Apply Baseline plugin to iceberg-hive
body: This PR applies Baseline to iceberg-hive and resolves #157.

title: Replace hidden dependency on commons-compress with JDK zip
Remove usage of deprecated Schema.Field constructor
body:
Without the cast, the deprecated variant that takes JsonNode is
chosen by Java's overload resolution because it is "more specific".

title: Use JDK StandardCharsets instead of commons-io
guava: upgrade it to latest
body:
Trying to fix #162 

Test Plan: ./gradlew build (it runs unit tests)

title: Use Iceberg tables as sinks in Spark Structured Streaming
body:
This PR allows us to use Iceberg tables as sinks in Spark Structured Streaming and resolves #178.

Only `Complete` and `Append` modes are supported.

title: ORC column map fix
body:
This PR addresses https://github.com/apache/incubator-iceberg/issues/213
Thanks!

cc @rdsr

title: Apply Baseline plugin to iceberg-spark
body:
This PR applies Baseline to iceberg-spark and resolves #161. 

**Open Questions**

I’ve picked the default Scala formatting from Baseline. Here are a few points I want to bring attention to:
  - Baseline applies `FileLengthChecker` with 800 as `maxFileLength`. Is it ok for us?
  - Baseline applies `CyclomaticComplexityChecker` with 10 as the max value. Shall we make it 12 as in Java?
  - Baseline applies `MethodLengthChecker` with 50 as `maxLength`. Shall we make it 150 as in Java?
  - Baseline applies `ReturnChecker`. Is it ok for us?

The description of rules can be found [here](http://www.scalastyle.org/rules-dev.html).

title: Enforce a blank line after the header
body: This PR enforces a blank line after the Apache header to make all files consistent.

title: Change Spark data source option style
body: This PR removes `iceberg` prefixes from options in the Spark data source and resolves #212.

title: Fix FastAppends in BaseTransaction
body: This PR fixes `newFastAppend` in `BaseTransaction`.

title: Extend Table API to get snapshots by id
body:
This PR introduces a way to get a snapshot by id via the `Table` API.

This change is needed to efficiently support Iceberg tables as sinks in Spark Structured Streaming. In particular, this change allows us to efficiently retrieve the parent snapshot by id.

title: ReplaceManifests: use manifest writer length instead of estimate
body: The manifest writer API now allows for getting the length written while the writer is still open. This PR removes the code for estimating the size written when replacing manifests, and uses the writer length instead.

title: Support parsing of special characters in TypeToSchema visitor
body: This addresses #216

title: Fix concurrent access to lazy PartitionSpec methods
body: This was causing `NullPointerException` in `PartitionData.get`. When two Spark tasks started at the same time on an executor, both would load the same partition spec instance because of the spec parser's cache. One thread would create `lazyJavaClasses` and another would access it before it was fully initialized, causing Spark's converter to partition to cache null classes for some partitions, leading to the NPE from `PartitionData.get`.

title: Fix uncommitted file clean-up in transactions
body:
This adds a callback for deleting files to `SnapshotProducer` and uses that callback in `Transaction`
to track deletes instead of running them. When a transaction is committed, the last set of deletes are run so that the actual deletes are for the last commit of each operation in the transaction.

This ensures that unused metadata files are not deleted when operations are committed to the transaction. The set of files that needs to be deleted may change, so only the last set of deletes in a transaction should be run.

This was discovered when appending a manifest file using #201. A manifest was copied, merged with existing manifests, and deleted when committing a change to the transaction. When the transaction committed, it conflicted and re-ran the manifest file append. Manifests from the conflicting commit were merged into existing manifests instead of the copy of the appended manifest, so the copy that had already been deleted was used in table metadata.

title: Remove uncessary precondition checks
body: These checks unnecessarily prevent checking how much data has been written.

title: [Baseline] Apply baseline to iceberg-orc #158
body: Apply baseline to iceberg-orc #158

title: Add ORC support for listPartitions
body:
Adding support for listing partitions in ORC file formats.

PTAL @rdblue @rdsr
